chapter.title: Point of Sale
chapter.para: Now that you've installed and set up xTuple POS, you are ready to begin processing Sales. In this chapter we will review how to process Cash Register Sales. The following topics will be covered:

listitem.para: Customer Information
Sale Items
Sale Details
Payment Processing

section.title: Customer Information
section.para: The processing of retail Sales is handled by the Cash Register. And so for this scenario, we'll need to open a Cash Register to begin. To open a Cash Register, follow these steps:

listitem.para: Follow this path: Sales > Retail > Cash Registers
Highlight the Cash Register you want to use
Select the USE button
The following screen will appear:

note.para: Any pending Sales or transactions which are incomplete will appear on the Cash Register's "Sales" screen. In the event that a Customer decides to continue shopping, you can save the Sale, service the next Customer, and then reopen the transaction to complete the Sale when the previous Customer returns.

section.para: Now that our Cash Register is open, let's begin a new Sale and capture the Customer's information. For this example, we'll assume this is a new Customer. To get started, follow these steps:

listitem.para: Select the NEW button—this will open the Retail Sale screen
In the "Number" field, the next retail Sale number is entered automatically
From the "Type" field, select the "Sale" option
Select the NEW button to enter Customer information

note.para: Capturing Customer information can be useful for marketing (and other) purposes. However, you can configure xTuple POS to not require Customer information at the point of sale. If no Customer information is required, then the "Customer" tab on the Retail Sale screen will be hidden.

listitem.para: Enter a Customer Number
Enter a Customer Name
Enter Customer billing information
Select the OK button
Customer information is now completed, as shown in the following screen:

section.para: If you have a repeat Customer, it is not necessary to re-enter the Customer's information. In that scenario, you would follow these steps:

listitem.para: Select the Customer lookup button [...]
The following screen will appear:

section.para: After you locate the repeat Customer's record, simply select it to associate the Customer information with the new Sale. Using this feature for repeat Customers will save time. You won't have to re-enter Customers' information each time they visit your store.

section.title: Sale Items
section.para: Once you've entered Customer information, you are now ready to begin entering Sale Items. To begin entering Sale Items, follow these steps:

listitem.para: Select the "Items" tab
Select the ADD button
Specify a Sale Item in the "Item Number" field
Then enter the quantity being sold

note.para: Item Pricing is configured using xTuple ERP. For more information on Item Pricing, please consult the xTuple ERP Reference Guide.

listitem.para: Select the ADD button again
Specify another Sale Item
Then enter the quantity being sold
The results are shown in the following screen:

mediaobject.caption: Adding Items to a Retail Sale

tip.para: If you add a Sale Item in error, simply highlight the line item and select the REMOVE button. This will remove the Item from the Sale. You may need to add the replacement item first, if there are no other line items on the Sale.

section.para: You have several methods available to you when it comes to entering Sale Items:

listitem.para: You can scan Item bar codes
You can type Item Numbers in manually
Or you can locate products using the Item lookup button [...]

section.para: The following screen shows what you will see when using the Item lookup button:

note.para: At the bottom of the Retail Sale screen you will notice your running total. This total will include Tax (if recorded)—and the set up for Tax is part of your xTuple ERP accounting configuration. Please consult the xTuple ERP Reference Guide for more information on Tax configuration.

section.title: Sale Details
section.para: The final tab on the Retail Sale screen is the "Detail" tab. This tab includes additional information you may need to collect regarding the Sale—including the name of the sales associate who processed the Sale and any miscellaneous notes you may want to record.

note.para: A Sales Rep is required to successfully complete a Sale. If you cannot complete a Sale (e.g., cannot select the SAVE button), this may mean you have not specified a Sales Rep on the Sale "Detail" screen.

section.para: The system can be configured to automatically make the logged-in user the Sales Rep for a Sale. This configuration is discussed in more detail in the xTuple ERP Reference Guide. However, the following points provide an overview of the process:

listitem.para: Locate Employee records: System > Employees
Create Employee records for your system users
On Employee records, specify Employees are Sales Reps
Create Sales Rep records for Employees
Now when users log in, they will be recognized as a Sales Reps

section.title: Payment Processing
section.para: Now that the Sale is complete, we are ready to process payment. From an accounting perspective, any inventory movement will be tracked in the General Ledger (G/L) as soon as you process the payment. The final accounting—including sale and cash information—will not hit the G/L until the point when the Cash Register is closed.
To process a payment, follow these steps:

listitem.para: Select the PAYMENT button
The following screen will appear:

tip.para: If the PAYMENT button is grayed out this could mean you still have required fields which have not yet been completed. Once all required fields have been completed, the PAYMENT button will activate—and you can then accept payment.

section.para: As you can see in our example, the Customer has chosen to write a Check for the bulk of the Sale. The remaining balance will be paid in cash. This illustrates the ability of xTuple POS to accept split payments. Had the Customer wanted to pay with a Credit Card instead of a Check, we would have selected the "Credit Card" option—and then entered the required information. Keep in mind that you can only enter Check or Credit Card payments if the amount entered in the Cash amount field is less than the total due.
To ensure the Customer gets a receipt as proof of the Sale, follow these steps:

listitem.para: Select the "Print Receipt" option. (The default print settings can be changed using the OPTIONS button. These settings are particular to this screen—and to the terminal you are working on.)
Select the OK button
